titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I celebrated in the Abbey at midday; & preached in the afternoon.
S. Margaret's was surrendered to one Ottley, the secretary of the Imperial Sunday Alliance – a most tiresome & verbose fanatick. At Evensong he continued for no less than 50 minutes.

body.p: On Monday, April 4th, the Brotherhood dined here.

p.hi: , I dined with Lady Ilbert. I signed & sent off the presentation of Addis to All Saints, Knightsbridge.

body.p: On Wednesday April 6th Ella went off to Torquay to stay with Mrs Dundas.
On Thursday, April 7th Archdeacon Stocks stayed the night.

p.hi: the 'Times' announced the appointment of Hicks as Bp. of Lincoln.
